title: Kobe's Guide to Group D
body: Before I dive into how it might shape up, make sure you take the time check out Jatt’s Group A Guide as well as Deficio and Krepo’s breakdown of Group C. We'll get Group B to you in the coming days as well!

replies.body: This is probably the most exciting group to watch. Can't wait for worlds to start!

Good breakdown for those of us who have not followed other regions all split, thank you. I think you were a little too generous in your assessment of Samsung and Splyce though. Playing impressively in the gaunlet against the 2nd tier of their region should not be given as much praise as Samsung got, even with a KT win. And Splyce is just not at the level of play of the other teams at World's as the stats you quoted clearly show. Not even middle of the pack, but bottom of the barrel in some cases. 

This group will not be as deadly as it sounds. It is for TSM and RNG to fumble away in my opinion.
definitely agree, not sure this one qualifies as the "group of death"

Looking at how TSM was in the group, meaning C9 couldn't end up in it as well, Splyce was the toughest 3rd seed team that could end up in the group. If you replace SSG with SKT then you have an undisputed group of death imo. And Samsung has the talent, it just comes down to consistency.
I still think that Group B is the "Group of Death" with their teams. but group D is a close second.

TSM was horrible last year, they choked a lot. they will do a repeat this year i believe...lmfao that TSM is gone literally the only play left from last year is Bjerg. its a completely new TSM. with out being biased on an NA team look at the standings, look at the stats for this year so far. next argument is "they havent played international yet" they boot camped in Korea and practiced with the likes of SKT and won, now scrimms dont matter which i agree the only thing that matter is the practice, and what they learn from playing against them to make them even more better.  so saying TSM is gunna choke based on last year is absurd, come up with a better excuse to not cheer them on and being a "fan boy". saying that they havent played against Europe,korea,ect is even more laughable because they havent played against NA either now here we insert a lol its NA it doesnt matter,  but C9 has been pushing it hard, their training is more intense and intern making them even more agressive very much so like TSM. CLG though...yeah no...they are dunzo..sorry CLG fans the only other NA team that stood a chance would have been Immortals..but they choke when it comes to playoffs..they did spring and of course summer split, even though they had back to back regular split performances. regardless of the team name and the hype surrounding them TSM is the better team is D fallowed by SS based on how complete the team is and their lane production as well. why else would people hype up SKT that korean hype and nobody says SKT fanboys? or how about G2? how about any other team that wins their region, i would say dominates but only a couple of teams actually did that.  so TSM fans rejoice in the fact they hipster NA traitors would rather support any korean team, chinese team and hell maybe even a EU team because they would never root for TSM. risk being called a TSM fanboy who gives a shit, jump on the SKT, jump on G2, jump on EDG, jump on FW..hell maybe even RNG but just not TSM. lol {{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}

I theoretically would fall in line with your NA traitor. I don't care for TSM and never did. I do not like reginald and do not like the fanbase either. TSM is full of bandwagoners and I refuse to be one of the sheep. Being from NA it's disappointing how poor the talent pool is and that most of the best players in NA are from either EU or Korea. Personally I am not rooting for any of the NA squads, but I am not rooting for one of the power house squads just for the sake of hoping they win. I am rooting for H2K, who has a lot of potential as a squad despite it being unlikely that they will win. When choosing a team in league to cheer for, I gravitate towards a specific player or personality with the team. I liked CLG when Hotshot played. I still like Fnatic, but liked them more when xPeke, Soaz, and Cyanide were on the squad and now with H2K I like the roster and I like Pr0lly. Judge me if you want as an NA traitor, but I will not cheer for a team just because it's the popular thing to do.

Based on ownership and fans regardless of how players preform is very much like enjoying a bands music but hating the fans and producer so in turn you dislike the band even though they are talented and showing results.  Everyone has the right to like a team  or dislike a team regaurdless of origin and for whatever reason no matter how silly, I was a bit hasty in my term NA traitor and to that apologize. I just want a western team to win worlds and TSM regardless of problems and history are in line to do so a long with G2 which also has had an amazing split. Thats why I have them atop in their groups. "Popular" for what? Fans spew nonsense most times and in fact the majority of players in league are toxic and tilt their team. But uts like that with any team whether its esports, physical sports or anything really.weather it because you the feel, the taste, the sound..because its from where you or holds some sort of value to you. It doesnt mater how popular it is or who's or whats ruining it for you. I know every team, every division has shitty fans that only want to talk shit about teams and other fans. Im not trying to do that or insinuate that I am. I just believe that the performance of teams need to be recognized not from only last year at worlds but this year aswell. Specially a whole new line up for TSM, you cant say they will be like last year, not the same players, not the same state of mind...and not even close to the productivity from their splits. Same with any EU team LPL team and ao forth..I mean like how SKT did but they are poised to win yet again.. this year is surprising to say the least. There will be upsets and there will be what we expected and only until they play on that stage will we actually know how it'll end. Im not counting any team out specially because of or popularity or because they are underdogs, every team has a chance no matter how futile it may seem. I more so wanted the NA community to rally for what would seem to be their only "hope" to win worlds.. which is wishful thinking of course, plus most arguments made for disliking TSM has been the whole repeating last year, performance against other countries and other things for performance but yours is a straight up dislike cause you just dont like them and I respect that. Its not some daft argument or reason. So thanks for being respectful and sharing your views and thoughts. Youre a good fan of the game and again I apologize for my previous post about being a traitor to NA I didnt mean to make you feel like I was targeting you or was trying to offend you in anyway. In the perfect world our minds get blown and a wildcard team wins..how crazy would that be???

Another NA biased post. The last few worlds if I recall correctly there was always an NA team advertised as "the best in NA history" and every year that happens, NA never even made it to semis. The best NA team in my opinion was the very first C9 where they totally smashed NA, well they didn't go too far in the end in worlds. I really enjoy watching NA and have been watching many NA LCS since season 2 but to place TSM first in the group is pretty ridiculous. NA has never showed up in worlds, and as strong as TSM is in NA, I don't have most faith in how they stack up against other teams.

This TSM Squad IS the BEST team NA has produced over the years, and with NA showing how strong they are in MSI, they stand a great chance against these other teams, who didn't have a really cohesive split to get them here. RNG may have performed well getting here, they still had a rocky season, and sometimes playoff miracles just happen. Splyce honestly isn't a large threat to any of the teams in  this group, and the only team i think that will really threaten TSM is samsung, and they still have some kinks to work out.

How can you really judge this off of MSI, when NA's team who surprisingly came in second has plummeted ever since, whereas the European team has only gotten better. Also CLG did not face the two strongest teams at the time at MSI in Royal or SKT to get to the finals. Judge MSI as you want, but it's not really a great indicator in judging how well a team will perform at worlds. Also how is the NA squad any better than what C9 was supposed to be in Season 3. The NA region at the bottom and mid has only gotten worse and has resulted in NA having only two actually legitimate teams in C9 and TSM.
seriously, did you think CLG was better than RNG at MSI? If you consider the performance at MSI and later, for me RNG SAMSUNG then TSM,

I think placing TSM as first may have been a little too hype but I don't think there has been that much NA bias outside of some crazy power rankings.  It seems like a lot of these analyses are based off of MSI results.  NA did poorly at MSI last year and most analysts predicted that TSM wouldn't win 1 game in their group for worlds after that.  We did very well at MSI this year and we don't have much else to base predictions off of.

My bias against TSM won't let me put them first. I'm Korean and I like Crown so I am hoping for Samsung, RNG, TSM, and SPY. Samsung is better than most give them credit for in my opinion. PS, TSM is really good at choking at worlds sooooo.....

TSM was awful at worlds last year, but this may work to their advantage.  The Asian teams may get too cocky and not take them seriously.  I would love to see NA do well at worlds, but I'm not holding my breath.
If we're basing our cockiness off last year's worlds results… China has no reason to be cocky. They were even WORSE than NA last year.
{{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}}
What about Curse?
They are 4.4
Alright! I thought they were going to save this one for last. TSM!
Nah they're saving the best for last :P

In all honesty, TSM has shown time and time again this split that they have what it takes to adapt on the fly, and they show promise this year. This group may be hard for them, but they have shown the capabilities to overcome obstacles and they continue to grow as a team each and every week. I followed along with their 'Legends' series, and they show the capability to work together and constantly improve. This TSM roster may not have the same international experience under their belt as other teams, but they still stand to have a really good chance to make it out of groups this year.
NA probably should learn to be humble first before they actually show up anything in World.

I feel that it's the fans that are cocky and not the players; especially after last year. Watching Bjerg react to group draw he definitely respects his opposition. He didn't seem to take them lightly at all.
lol TSM not gonna make out of the group
And if they actually do place first or just make it out of groups won't you look like a total dunce lulz.
or maybe, i will come back here and LMAO at your comment when TSM get crashed in the group stage =)
or maybe, I will come back here and LMFAO at your comment when TSM do make it out of groups. =)
Here i am, coming as promise, laughing at your comment right now =D, where the fk r you huh?

oh shit, we have a badass over here!
Okay TSM crashed. You win, ya got me. Lmao

TSM has this in the bag. All they need to do is just keep playing as they have in the spring split. That's it. Unless RNG plays completely out of their minds and TSM fumbles. TSM is going to come out 1st in the group. The question really is will RNG play like they did at the end of LPL or will they rise? If they rise they will be second if not third (to Samsung Galaxy). Sorry Splyce, but learn from this experience and try again next year.
lol "if they rise they will be second". excuse me but if RNG rise they will just crash everyone in the group.

For them to "crash everyone" TSM would need to play like absolute crap. RNG has been very inconsistent, and these Chinese mixed "super teams" seem to have A LOT of problems. If they play well they can beat Samsung, but they're not going to beat TSM.
As a rational audience i would only agree that TSM=RNG=SS and they have equal amount of chance of getting out. I would never rate any team above the other two at this point, not like biased TSM fan
how about group B? did you guys covered them yet?
They are doing that last
While CoreJJ showed up in playoffs, Wraith was still their main support and they really didn't give him much credit at all. I'm surprised they only mentioned him once in the entire article.
na just like over hype their team

Should be a competitive group. I realize splyce doesn't have the worlds experience, but people are underestimating them. I don't see them getting out of the group, but in no means are they at the bottom of teams at worlds. Don't be surprised if they take a game off of tsm and either royal or samsung. Personally, I see samsung and royal getting out of the group.
